page.title: 04Riccall Disused Airfield
page.content: A local man's first job, at the age of fourteen, was working on the runway. He said that the first aeroplane to land at Riccall was a Lancaster Bomber which had flown from Aldershot. Its landing was intended to test the runway. However by the time the Lancaster touched down, the sun had melted part of the runway's surface. The surface cracked on impact and it had to be re-surfaced! During the war,the airfield was used for storing bombs and ammunition a included a bomb-dispersal unit.The site of this unit is now Beaumont's scrapyard.A few years ago, a de-activated bomb was found in the scrapyard. Also during the war, part of King Rudding Lane was closed so that ammunition could be moved in safety.
